Role of Academia or Industry in Cultivating the Skill

  1. Academia plays important role for cultivating soft skills like proper communication, coordination with team members during projects, ability to contribute, etc.
  2. In Industries, training sessions take place so that trainee gets used to the maintenance softwares, tools and all the prcoesses. https://www.yumpu.com/en/document/read/32068758/maintenance-planner-training-hbr

Tools Supporting the Skill

  1. P-F Curve

    2. It is the graph that shows the health of the system over time to identify the interval between potential failure and functional failure.

  2. FMEA (Failure Mode and Effects Analysis)

    3. It is a process that identifies potential failures with assets and other areas of business.

  3. Root Cause Analysis

    4. It is a systematic process of identifying the origin of an incident.

  4. Lean Six Sigma

    5. It is a process that aims to systematically eliminate waste and reduce variation.

  5. SCADA

    6. It is a computer control system that is used to monitor and control plant processes.

  6. Maintenance Log

    7. An equipment maintenance log is a document that records activities that have been performed on an asset.

  7. O&M Manual(Operation and Maintenance Manual)

    8. It is a comprehensive document that provides all the details necessary about a physical plant as well as individual pieces of equipment to help the maintenance staff keep everything running smoothly.


Skill Self-Assessment (My Skill Score (1 - 10) and Reasons for Self-Assigned Score

My Self-Assessed Skill Score: 6/10

Reason:

Doesn't have any industrial experience. Only cultivated the soft skills in Academia. Also due to the term project, it doesn't have any phases. So the experience for things like version controlling, cost estimation, user complaints or the scheduled modification/updates never came. Also the tools and softwares used for it are based on the industry type which are taught in training sessions. Got only the theoretical knowledge about this.
